result.execSummary:
The defendant Benito L Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 5 years bifurcated sentence.
Concurrent with: Current sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample, and pay mandatory surcharge, as required by law if not previously provided.  All other court costs are waived.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Follow all Family Court orders.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including Racine Vocational Ministry program and Focus on Fatherhood at YMCA. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

BTC: Finding of guilt Cts 1 and 2; DRI Cts 3 & 4. PSI ordered. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the co-defendant, DSC. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
04/23/2015 - BOND AMENDED:   Defendant to be on house arrest at home of mother, on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). May go to work at Pias' as long as verifiable schedule provided to ZCI. No cont w/any gang member or street gang. No cont w/C.I. No communication about this case or individuals involved - direct or electronically, including social media. Defendant may be released to mother.
